23453673.Title of the Study: Depressive symptoms and interpersonal needs as mediators of forgiveness and suicidal behavior among rural primary care patients

28477504.Title of the Study: Adult attachment style and anxiety - The mediating role of emotion regulation

25888339.Title of the Study: Negative future self as a mediator in the relationship between insight and depression in psychotic disorders

26395975.Title of the Study: Identifying mechanisms that underlie links between COMT genotype and aggression in male adolescents with ADHD

27920734.Mediation Method Used: Structural equation modeling (SEM) with moderated mediation per Muller et al. (2005), estimated in Mplus

26869979.Title of the Study: Am I Overweight? A Longitudinal Study on Parental and Peers Weight-Related Perceptions on Dietary Behaviors and Weight Status Among Adolescents
26869979.Mediation Method Used: PROCESS (Hayes) multiple mediation with sequential mediators and bootstrapped indirect effects

27252666.Mediation Method Used: Structural equation modeling (SEM) with WLSMV; product-of-coefficients (MacKinnon) and bias-corrected bootstrap CIs

28193310.Title of the Study: Depressive symptoms and inflammation are independent risk factors of fatigue in breast cancer survivors
28193310.Mediation Method Used: PROCESS (SPSS) with Sobel test and bootstrap

28647670.Mediation Method Used: Baron and Kenny (1986) regression-based mediation analysis

29172592.Mediation Method Used: Hayes PROCESS macro (bias-corrected bootstrap) mediation and moderated mediation (Models 4 and 14)

24012069.Mediation Method Used: Baron and Kenny (1986) logistic regression approach

28778553.Mediation Method Used: PROCESS macro for SPSS (Hayes) with bootstrapped indirect effects (5,000 samples)

28871234.Mediation Method Used: Preacher and Hayes SPSS macro with bias-corrected bootstrap (5,000 resamples)

27933010.Mediation Method Used: Difference method (Baron & Kenny causal steps; path/difference approach)

29294372.Mediation Method Used: Structural equation modeling (SEM) with maximum likelihood and bootstrapped indirect effects
